newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela 96 balance of payments $6.3 bln surplus.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela 96 balance of payments $6.3 bln surplus.

text.p: Venezuela's balance of payments is expected to register a $6.3 billion surplus surplus for 1996, and its current account a $7.3 billion surplus, according to the Central Bank's annual year-end review of the Venezuelan economy.
The Central Bank said the positive outcome, "in contrast to the adverse results that have been seen since 1991" was due to high international oil prices.
"This has permitted an important recuperation in international reserves, which are estimated to close the year above $15 billion," the review said.
The document added that the capital account deficit would close 1996 at around $500 million, compared with the 2.329 billion deficit of the year before.
